content: 1.3Purimikā ca pacchimikā ca.

1.3Saṅghasuṭṭhutāya saṅghaphāsutāya … dummaṅkūnaṁ puggalānaṁ niggahāya pesalānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ phāsuvihārāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ āsavānaṁ saṁvarāya samparāyikānaṁ āsavānaṁ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ verānaṁ saṁvarāya samparāyikānaṁ verānaṁ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ vajjānaṁ saṁvarāya samparāyikānaṁ vajjānaṁ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ bhayānaṁ saṁvarāya samparāyikānaṁ bhayānaṁ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ saṁvarāya samparāyikānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭighātāya … gihīnaṁ anukampāya pāpicchānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pakkhupacchedāya … appasannānaṁ pasādāya pasannānaṁ bhiyyobhāvāya … saddhammaṭṭhitiyā vinayānuggahāya.
1.3Attano ca diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṁ sampassamāno pacchimañca janataṁ anukampamāno.
1.6Tesaṁ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati.
2.4Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto bhikkhū āmantesi:

4.2Idha bhikkhave bhikkhu divasaṁ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti rattiyā paṭhamaṁ yāmaṁ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti rattiyā majjhimaṁ yāmaṁ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappeti pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasi karitvā rattiyā pacchimaṁ yāmaṁ paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti.
10.3So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto vanantaññeva pavisāmi.

2.1Atha kho te bhikkhū rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
3.5ye pacchimāya disāya pāṇā paraṁ yojanasataṁ tesu daṇḍaṁ nikkhipāhi
1.7Samādhi nu kho bhante pubbe pacchā ñāṇaṁ
6.1Yathā pure tathā pacchā

2.2Idha bhikkhave yassaṁ parisāyaṁ therā bhikkhū na bāhulikā honti na sāthalikā okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā vīriyaṁ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya tesaṁ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati.
11.2Tesaṁ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati.
4.5vokkamati ayamāyasmā purimavohārā pacchimavohāraṁ
13.3So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.

1.11Yatra hi nāma rañño purisā daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṁ gāḷhabandhanaṁ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṁ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathikāya rathikaṁ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṁ parinetvā dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā dakkhiṇato nagarassa sīsaṁ chindissanti.
3.3So paṭibujjhitvā purimaṁ kāyaṁ abbhunnāmetvā pacchimaṁ kāyaṁ anuviloketi.
5.2pacchimāya cepi disāya viharati sveva aratiṁ sahati na taṁ arati sahati
3.1Yāvatā bhikkhave dhammā saṅkhatā vā asaṅkhatā vā virāgo tesaṁ aggamakkhāyati yadidaṁ madanimmadano pipāsavinayo ālayasamugghāto vaṭṭupacchedo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
5.5rattiyā pacchimaṁ yāmaṁ paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti.
4.3Tassa mayhaṁ bhante evarūpo padavītihāro ahosi seyyathāpi nāma puratthimā samuddā pacchimo samuddo.
2.3Tassa mayhaṁ bhante evarūpo padavītihāro ahosi seyyathāpi nāma puratthimā samuddā pacchimo samuddo.
2.1“Siyā kho pana bhikkhave ekabhikkhussapi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā pucchatha bhikkhave mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha:

3.4Seyyathāpi bhikkhave udakarahado gambhīro ubbhidodako. Tassa nevassa puratthimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṁ na pacchimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṁ na uttarāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṁ na dakkhiṇāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṁ devo ca kālena kālaṁ sammā dhāraṁ nānuppaveccheyya.
5.2madanimmadano pipāsavinayo ālayasamugghāto vaṭṭupacchedo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
4.3‘yassa vo mātāpitaro bhattuno dassanti atthakāmā hitesino anukampakā anukampaṁ upādāya tassa bhavissāma pubbuṭṭhāyiniyo pacchānipātiniyo kiṅkārapaṭissāviniyo manāpacāriniyo piyavādiniyo’ti.
1.3Vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto mahāvanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
7.3Etāni bhikkhu rukkhamūlāni etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha bhikkhu mā pamādattha mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṁ vo amhākaṁ anusāsanī”ti.
7.3Etāni bhikkhu rukkhamūlāni etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha bhikkhu mā pamādattha mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṁ vo amhākaṁ anusāsanī”ti.
18.11So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto
6.3Tesaṁ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjissati.

423At a classref hrefsn51.20SN 51.20a we find the most detailed explanation of how these are applied in practice. This sutta brings in a number of practices familiar from elsewhere in the suttas such as the contemplation of the 31 parts of the body. While most of these are straightforward there is a somewhat obscure Pali idiom that begs a little clarification. That is the phrase “as before so after as after so before” i langpi translatenoyathā pure tathā pacchā yathā pacchā tathā purei called the “perception of continuity” i langpi translatenopacchāpuresaññāi. Similar phrases are found in several places in the context of meditation a classref hrefthag6.4Thag 6.4a a classref hrefsn47.10SN 47.10a a classref hrefan7.61AN 7.61a a classref hrefan3.90AN 3.90a. In the Vinaya the same phrase is used to emphasize that the status of a mendicant remains unchanged. In meditation it points to the need for constant and consistent effort in maintaining one’s focus. As part of a series of related idioms—as above so below as by day so by night as this is so is that—it indicates how the process of meditation moves from diversity and differentiation towards unity and oneness.

suttaplex.blurb: Five factors to be observed by a companion who follows on alms-round; this would typically be a novice or junior mendicant.
suttaplex.translated_title: An Ascetic to Follow Behind on Almsround
